revised_title: Accelerator Mass Spectrometry of Heavy Elements: Applications and Techniques
tldr: This article discusses the use of accelerator mass spectrometry (AMS) to measure the concentrations of heavy radioisotopes in various applications. The authors describe their experiments with heavy-ion accelerators, focusing on half-life measurements, radioisotope detection in solar neutrino experiments, and the determination of 41Ca concentrations in natural samples. They also discuss a method of isobar separation using a gas-filled magnetic field region, which improves sensitivity in detecting low concentrations of heavy elements.
